original_solution_mapping.L1: He started off with 150 channels and they took 20 away and added 12 so he has 150-20+12 = <<150-20+12=142>>142 channels
original_solution_mapping.L2: He called and asked to reduce his 142 channels by 10 channels and added 8 sports channels so he now has 142-10+8 = <<142-10+8=140>>140 channels
original_solution_mapping.L3: He ordered the wrong sports package and the new one adds an additional 7 channels for a total of 140+7 = <<140+7=147>>147 channels

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6642.
    Returns: the total number of channels Larry has.
    """
    # L1
    initial_channels = 150 # 150 channels
    channels_taken_away_1 = 20 # took 20 channels away
    channels_added_1 = 12 # replaced those with 12 channels
    channels_after_first_change = initial_channels - channels_taken_away_1 + channels_added_1

    # L2
    channels_reduced_2 = 10 # reduce his package by 10 more channels
    sports_package_added_1 = 8 # add the sports package which is 8 channels
    channels_after_second_change = channels_after_first_change - channels_reduced_2 + sports_package_added_1

    # L3
    supreme_sports_package_added = 7 # that package adds 7 more channels
    final_channels = channels_after_second_change + supreme_sports_package_added

    # FA
    answer = final_channels
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He started off with {initial_channels} channels and they took {channels_taken_away_1} away and added {channels_added_1} so he has {initial_channels}-{channels_taken_away_1}+{channels_added_1} = <<{initial_channels}-{channels_taken_away_1}+{channels_added_1}={channels_after_first_change}>>{channels_after_first_change} channels

He called and asked to reduce his {channels_after_first_change} channels by {channels_reduced_2} channels and added {sports_package_added_1} sports channels so he now has {channels_after_first_change}-{channels_reduced_2}+{sports_package_added_1} = <<{channels_after_first_change}-{channels_reduced_2}+{sports_package_added_1}={channels_after_second_change}>>{channels_after_second_change} channels

He ordered the wrong sports package and the new one adds an additional {supreme_sports_package_added} channels for a total of {channels_after_second_change}+{supreme_sports_package_added} = <<{channels_after_second_change}+{supreme_sports_package_added}={final_channels}>>{final_channels} channels

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He started off with 150 channels and they took 20 away and added 12 so he has 150-20+12 = <<150-20+12=142>>142 channels

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'channels_after_first_change' (value: 142) was reported instead of 'final_channels' (value: 147).
